title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard without typing anything, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' This message is displayed even when the package name field is empty.
EB: The New Java Package wizard should not display an error/warning message when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled in this case.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the New Package Wizard
2. Leave the package name field empty
3. Observe the message that appears at the top
